values.title: Consultant

values.summary:
Greg is a bright, creative, and energetic software developer who combines veteran experience with youthful enthusiasm. Beginning his career writing Super Nintendo games in assembly language, Greg has moved into areas ranging from large scale ERP to complex port 80 caching appliances running an  embedded OS. His core passion, though, in keeping with his game programmer roots, lies in front end implementations to which end he leveraged another  passion (classical piano music) as an excuse to gain proficiency in web technologies. Thus was Ecital born in 2007.

Recently he has engaged in a number of extracurricular projects. For example, a fun (as opposed to stodgy) quiz engine offers students a way to hone their mastery of various subject matter such as vocabulary skills. He is currently researching the Wikipedia API with a view toward integration, and working with the Zend framework to that end.

He wrote a simple vector graphics 3D flight simulator ("JSFlite") in two weekends last December.

* 3D game engine development - http://www.hedgerholdings.com

* LAMP Web technologies: Linux, Apache, MySQL, Perl.

* Specializing in servers, multithreaded applications, TCP/IP, Telnet, HTTP, OSI layers 3-7.

* Extensive OpenSSL experience (SSL/TLS).

* Extensive GUI work in C/C++/C# and Java.

* Multivariate regression analysis to derive complex formulae through function plotting along multiple domains.

* Performance enhancements through practical, common-sense solutions.

* Data scraping.

* Reductionist, perennial autodidact, multifacted.

Can produce clear, workable designs from requirements.  Can tackle tough problems - quickly - using balance of inductive and deductive methods.

The ability to balance an ideal with constraints of reality is critical to success in most endeavors.  I believe all deserve respect and affirmation - the light, air, and water that will bring about the blossom of potential realized.

values.headline: Director of Engineering at IMVU

values.summary:
IMVU, Inc. (http://www.imvu.com) is an online social game where members use 3D avatars to meet new people, chat, create and play games with their friends. IMVU has reached 50 million registered users, 10+ million unique visitors per month and a $50+ million annualized revenue run rate. IMVU has the world's largest virtual goods catalog of more than six million items, almost all of which are created by its own members.  IMVU is available in multiple languages on both Windows PC and Mac platforms, and for mobile users via its IMVU 2Go iPhone application, available in the Apple App Store.

IMVU has been recognized frequently, including Best Place to Work for the past 2 years, Inc. 500/5000, 8th fastest growing private tech company in Silicon Valley over the past 3 years, and 87th fastest growing tech company in North America over the past 4 years.  The company’s CEO, Cary Rosenzweig, was recognized as The Most Admired CEO among emerging growth companies in 2010 by the San Francisco Business Times.
 

Founded in 2004, IMVU is backed by venture investors Menlo Ventures, Allegis Capital, Bridgescale Partners and Best Buy Capital and is located in Mountain View, CA.  IMVU has been profitable since 2009.
IMVU recognized as:
Inc. 500: http://bit.ly/dv52wK
Red Herring 100: http://bit.ly/bbz5Ex
Best Place to Work: http://bit.ly/aAVdp8
----> AND WE ARE HIRING: http://www.imvu.com/jobs <----

values.headline: Undercaffeinated. Overconnected. And All Man.

values.summary:
My co-founder Joyce Park and I love The Web deeply.

So on 1/11/11 we incorporated PandaWhale with a mission TO EXPAND THE SEARCHABLE WEB...

PandaWhale is a site where people can save content they like, with a social sharing element.

But not everyone has to write! Most of our 8 million Monthly Active Users just read. And that's cool.

We are continually improving our product in public at http://pandawhale.com/ ...

You are invited to join us and try PandaWhale anytime.

Just please keep in mind that PandaWhale is a work in progress...

Even if we are an Alexa Top 10,000 website in the United States. Bless America!

More about PandaWhale was written lovingly by Semil Shah:

http://techcrunch.com/2013/06/30/pandawhales-slow-march-to-relevance/
values.title: Co-founder, Director, and CEO

values.summary:
106 Miles is a professional network of 8000 startup founders, engineers, and friends.

Founded in 2005 by Joyce Park and me, 106 Miles gets together several times a month in Silicon Valley, Southern California, and San Francisco.

OUR MISSION IS TO EDUCATE ENTREPRENEURIAL ENGINEERS.


New members are always welcome.

Join us on Meetup and follow us on Twitter and Facebook:

http://meetup.com/106miles
http://meetup.com/106milesSoCal

http://twitter.com/106miles
http://facebook.com/106miles



THE VALUES OF 106 MILES ARE REPUTATION, INNOVATION, SOLIDARITY, AND EDUCATION.

For more on that, see:
http://pandawhale.com/post/18266/the-values-of-106-miles-are-reputation-innovation-solidarity-and-education



As part of my duties as a 106 Miles citizen, I regularly mentor entrepreneurs of Omidyar Network, 500 Startups, The Quarry, AngelPad, and Hackers & Founders. 

Although, frankly, I am more of a tormentor because I ask "Why?" a lot. I believe you can't spell Wise without Why's.

Good times.

...

Grew up in New York. Educated at William & Mary in Virginia, and Caltech in Pasadena, CA.

I spend 99% of my waking time right now on PandaWhale. http://pandawhale.com/

Specialties: Innovation. Distribution. Evolution. Adaptation. Synthesis.

values.headline: Founder and Chief Architect, Nunook Interactive

values.summary:
Founder of the company that makes BrainNook, the next generation of learning games for schools and homes. BrainNook is a massively multiplayer social learning game that helps elementary school children develop math and language skills while playing in real time with classmates and friends. 

BrainNook is available as a browser-based game and as a series of iPad apps. It is mapped to the Common Core Standards used in schools across 45 US states.

Students solve more than 5 million math and language problems on the BrainNook platform across Web and iPad every month.

Raised seed funding from the Imagine K12 startup incubator in Silicon Valley. Designed and architected the product. Recruited a high quality team of programmers, artists, designers and educational advisors. Got coverage for BrainNook from top media outlets such as Techcrunch, VentureBeat and Forbes.

Grew the BrainNook userbase to over 100,000 kids and teachers across the US and internationally. Over 3 million games have been played on the BrainNook platform.

Speaking:
- SXSWEdu Presentation: "Collaborative Learning Through Social Games", Austin TX, March 2013
- Panelist, "Education 2.0 Startups Panel", Nasscom Product Conclave, Bangalore India, November 2012
- Techcrunch Disrupt Presentation: "BrainNook: The Next Generation of Learning Games", San Francisco CA, September 2011

values.headline: Senior Software Engineer / Interaction Designer at Vital Connect Inc.

values.summary:
* Designed and developed a Ruby websocket based realtime vitals, ECG and notifications streaming service.
* Implemented a Rails/Javascript/d3.js web application that displays realtime ECG and Vitals.
* Designed and developed ruby gems for a) internal web services calls and b) authentication.
* Designed, developed and documented VitalConnect external facing webservices API.
* Responsible for design and development of UI for monitoring real-time body vitals using backbone.js and Ruby on Rails.
values.title: Senior Software Engineer / Interaction Designer

values.summary:
I am an interaction designer, a Ruby on Rails and a backbone.js developer living in the San Francisco Bay Area. I hold a Masters in Information Science from UC Berkeley and have over five years experience in designing and building web applications in United States and India. 

In my current role at Vital Connect, I am responsible for designing and building real-time applications that track user's body vitals.

I have a passion for improving user productivity through design. In my earlier years of career, I spent time improving employee productivity through interaction design for clients like Deutsche Bank, Sallie Mae, Aetna etc.

 I’ve found that the ability to learn new skills quickly is almost always better than knowledge of a particular language. That said, these days I focus my learning on Ruby on Rails and backbone.js to design and build user friendly websites that solve real problems.

Specialties: Interaction Design Process: Design Research, Requirements Gathering, Task Analysis, Flow Diagrams, Scenarios, Personas, Wireframes, Prototypes, Detailed User Interface Specifications, Heuristic Evaluations.

Programming: Ruby on Rails, Ruby, EventMachine, Javascript, Node.js, jQuery, WebSockets, HTML5/CSS3, backbone.js, angular.js, d3.js, Git, R, C, Java, Python, Shell scripting and extensive knowledge of UNIX environment.

Other: Privacy, Location Based Services, Information Retrieval, Information Visualization
